title: Mission Description
content: According toNatasha, there may still be remaining medical supplies in the abandoned Rivet Town. The mission for you and Seele is to retrieve the supplies and deplete them of their final value... Erm, to let them shine and be useful in theclinic.Seele seems to have spent her entire childhood there... So this mission may hold a special value to her.The industrial town is just north of Boulder Town. Set out with everyone once you're packed up and ready.

speaker: Bronya
line: If we hadn't happened to be passing by... were you really planning to go into the Fragmentum alone?

speaker: Seele
line: Of course. What's all the fuss about? I've done that loads of times.

speaker: Bronya
line: So reckless... According to the rules of the Silvermane Guards , any expedition into the Fragmentum must have a squad of at least four members, as well as a communications officer.

speaker: Seele
line: Exactly, a rule of the Silvermane Guards. Don't apply your rules to us.

speaker: Natasha
line: ▶ Thank you, (Trailblazer). If we hadn't run into you two, Seele would've had to venture into the Fragmentum on her own.

speaker: Natasha
line: I know it's not her first rodeo, but the thought of her taking on those horrid monsters... I can't help but worry.

text: You seem to care about her a lot.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: Well, she grew up before my eyes after all. I don't want anything bad to happen to her.

text: I think she can handle it.

children.speaker: Natasha
children.line: I know, but she grew up before my eyes after all. I don't want anything bad to happen to her.

speaker: Natasha
line: Seele has been like this since she was little — impulsive and eager to be the best. For people who don't know her, they might find her... difficult...

speaker: Natasha
line: But you can trust her, even with your life. Stick around a bit longer and you'll see what I mean.

text: Find a vantage point for observation

title: Step Description
content: According to Natasha, there may still be remaining medical supplies in the abandoned Rivet Town. The mission for you and Seele is to retrieve the supplies and deplete them of their final value... Erm, to let them shine and be useful in the clinic.You arrive at the entrance of the mining town. Although this place looks to be completely desolate, in reality, Fragmentum monsters have been dwelling here for quite some time. This is a dangerous place.It'd be best to make observations and plan out your route before making your way in.

speaker: Seele
line: We're here. This is Rivet Town... *sigh* Everything looks familiar...

speaker: Seele
line: Let's go, and watch your step. I haven't been here in a long time. There are probably some monsters around.

speaker: Seele
line: We can't see anything here... Let's find higher ground to get a better view.

speaker: Seele
line: Way over there, see that house on the hill? That's Natasha's old orphanage.

speaker: Seele
line: After Oleg found me, he sent me there. I spent over half my childhood in that place.

text: That must be a time of plenty.

speaker: Seele
line: Natasha said that the house was donated by some rich businessman. Whatever his business may have been, he must have been a good person.

speaker: Seele
line: Oh, I miss those carefree days as a kid...

speaker: Seele
line: What? Nothing to say?

speaker: Bronya
line: No, it's just... this place seems familiar somehow. Never mind.

speaker: Seele
line: ...Weirdo.

speaker: Seele
line: Look down there. See the mess that remains of those old stalls? That's Rivet Town's market. The supplies Natasha wants are probably there.

speaker: Seele
line: Let's keep moving. Watch out for monsters.

text: Search for the supplies, go to the market square

title: Step Description
content: According to Natasha, there may still be remaining medical supplies in the abandoned Rivet Town. The mission for you and Seele is to retrieve the supplies and deplete them of their final value... Erm, to let them shine and be useful in the clinic.Seele believes that the supplies Natasha is after are likely to be stocked up in the town's market square. Why don't you head over there and take a look?

speaker: Seele
line: Careful! Enemies ahead.

speaker: Seele
line: These aren't like vagrants . They won't—

speaker: Bronya
line: Don't treat me like a new recruit. I'm all too familiar with the monsters of the Fragmentum. Let's get ready to fight!

speaker: Bronya
line: A... restaurant?

speaker: Seele
line: Heh, the most famous restaurant in town. Natasha would bring the kids who behaved well here for a special meal.

speaker: Bronya
line: So did she ever bring you?

speaker: Seele
line: Do I seem like I was a goody two-shoes? Of course not.

speaker: Bronya
line: The facilities here seem to be in pretty good shape, not like those of a place that has been abandoned for years.

speaker: Seele
line: Now that you mention it, it does seem a little... Could people still be living here? Impossible...

speaker: Seele
line: There's a bunch of crates piled over there. Maybe we can find what we're looking for.

speaker: Seele
line: Watch out for monsters. They like to hide. If you need to, clear the area before you dig for the supplies.

speaker: Seele
line: Darn, how could they all be empty? Now even the monsters are gathering supplies?

speaker: Bronya
line: The monsters of the Fragmentum don't need any materials we humans use. And if they did take anything, this place would look much messier...

speaker: Seele
line: You mean that someone else got here and took everything before us?

speaker: Bronya
line: It's just a guess, but there are also some footprints on the ground here.

speaker: Seele
line: *sniff* The scent of dirt is still fresh. They can't have come too long before us.

speaker: Seele
line: Let's go then. We need to find something, even if we have to search every corner of this market.

text: Look for missing supplies on the market square

title: Step Description
content: You come to the market square only to find the crates for medical supplies looted empty.The looter, however, seems too gentle for creatures in the Fragmentum, judging by what happened at the scene...Bronya and Seele have arrived at the scene and both of them think that this does not look like something that monsters would do.The perpetrator is likely to still be in the vicinity. Join Seele in her search on the square and leave no stone unturned!

speaker: Seele
line: ... Eric ?

speaker: Seele
line: Hey, brat! How could you come here by yourself. Don't you know how dangerous this place is?

speaker: Eric
line: S—Seele? Y—You aren't the boss of me! I—I can go wherever I want, it's none of your beeswax!

speaker: Seele
line: You took the materials and hid them all here? Not bad, kid.

speaker: Seele
line: But if we didn't take care of those monsters, what were you planning to do? Just stay here, shaking in your boots?

speaker: Eric
line: Wh—Who asked you to do anything? I was just about to escape, I didn't need your help at all!

speaker: Seele
line: Still stubborn, huh? Then tell me, how exactly were you gonna get those big metal plates out of here past those monsters?

speaker: Eric
line: Um... There's always a way...

text: That's enough. He's just a kid...

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Don't let him fool you. Everyone in the Underworld knows that this brat is a no-good thief. If I remember correctly, even the clothes you're wearing came off another kid's back?

text: Can you share the materials? They're to help injured people.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Don't be so polite to him. Everyone in the Underworld knows this brat is a no-good thief. If I remember correctly, even the clothes you're wearing came off another kid's back?

speaker: Eric
line: Uh... About that...

speaker: Seele
line: Tell us, what do you even want metal plates and gauze bandages for? We need them to save people.

speaker: Seele
line: What?

speaker: Eric
line: Uh... 200 shield ...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Are you kidding me? You want to negotiate?

text: I... don't have any money with me.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: Me neither... I never bring my coin purse with me on a mission.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: It's just 200... but I never bring my coin purse with me on a mission.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: ...Not much, but I didn't bring my coin purse.

speaker: Seele
line: You're actually planning to give this little crook money? I'm telling you. This is his same old trick—

speaker: Eric
line: No! ...Not this time. I really need money... my daddy...

speaker: Seele
line: Pretending to use your dad again as an excuse... If he knew about this, you'd be in big trouble.

speaker: Bronya
line: Seele! That's enough.

speaker: Bronya
line: It's Eric, right? Here, you can have this.

speaker: Eric
line: What... what's this?

speaker: Bronya
line: This is a medal given to me by the Architects ... See that blue stone in the middle? That's a Geomarrow crystal of the highest purity.

speaker: Bronya
line: You need money for your family, right? Take this and show it to a knowledgeable buyer, and they'll instantly know how valuable it is.

speaker: Eric
line: *sniffle* ...Th—Thank you! I...

speaker: Bronya
line: But... you'll have to promise me one thing: You'll never steal other people's things again. Promise?

speaker: Eric
line: I—I promise! I'll never steal things again!

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Then it's a deal. If you go back on your promise, I'm going to bring my Silvermane Guards with me and catch you myself! Here, take the medal and go back to the town. We already took care of any threat on the way. You'll be safe.

speaker: Eric
line: Th—Thank you, whoever you are! You guys can take all of these things!

speaker: Eric
line: Y—You guys need to be careful, too! There seems to be something real scary in that house up on the hill...

speaker: Eric
line: Oh, r—right! The road across from the market is blocked... If you wanna go further, you'll have to go to the shopping street.

speaker: Bronya
line: Got it. Thanks for the tip.

speaker: Seele
line: ...That object was pretty important to you, right?

speaker: Seele
line: Are you sure you're okay just giving it to Eric like that?

speaker: Bronya
line: If it will make him change his ways, it's more than worth it.

speaker: Seele
line: Hah, and what if he doesn't?

speaker: Bronya
line: From a young age, my mother taught me to be forgiving and to preserve the goodwill in people's hearts... Even if I am but a small glimmer of light in this world, I must try my best to shine brightly for others.

speaker: Bronya
line: I must give him a chance, Seele, because other people can't.

speaker: Seele
line: I don't really get what you just said. Anyway, ahem, we should get moving.

speaker: Seele
line: Eric said that we need to take the shopping street to go any further. I think I still remember where it is... this way.

text: Go to the orphanage and search for the supplies

title: Step Description
content: You discover that the culprit who robbed the supplies is a young thief named Eric. Bronya's generosity has compelled her to make the decision of trading with the thief for the supplies, even though Seele finds him to be untrustworthy.In return for Bronya's friendliness, Eric shares relevant intel regarding the orphanage with everyone. But does this mean that he will change his ways? The answer is unknown — however, maybe you will have the opportunity to witness it sometime in the future.Right now, your primary objective is to head to the orphanage and continue your search for the supplies.

speaker: Seele
line: This is the street alright. The orphanage should be at the end.

speaker: Bronya
line: These shops and signs... Why do I feel like I've seen them before?

speaker: Bronya
line: But when...?

title: Step Description
content: You finally find your way through the complex roads of Rivet Town and discover the path to the orphanage. As you make your way uphill, you can see the luxurious mansions that overlook the town, watching its every move each and every day.You see that Seele's expression has turned complex, but what's more confusing is that Bronya seems to be having the same emotions...

text: (Approach the stairs leading to the orphanage)

speaker: Seele
line: The entrance to the orphanage is up this way.

speaker: Seele
line: I wonder what the old place is like now. Maybe some things will still look familiar.

speaker: Bronya
line: These stairs... they seem to have become more narrow.

speaker: Seele
line: Almost there! I didn't expect this place to be so well preserved.

speaker: Seele
line: Y'know, if we could've worked together to push back the Fragmentum... maybe we wouldn't have had to take off and leave our homes behind.

speaker: Seele
line: ...We made it! It's been so long... but this place hasn't changed one bit.

speaker: Seele
line: Oh! It looks like there's a lot of stuff piled outside. Let's go see if there's any rubbing alcohol for Nat.

text: (If the player approaches the path to the left)

speaker: Seele
line: Hey, where are you going!? Let's look around the orphanage first.

speaker: Bronya
line: These crates have been sitting here for many years, right? Even if they have materials in them, are you sure they are still usable...?

speaker: Seele
line: Do you think undergrounders care about expiration dates? Even having any supplies is a miracle in itself.

speaker: Seele
line: No... No... Empty...

speaker: Seele
line: How are they all empty? Who could've—

speaker: Bronya
line: Careful! Enemy behind you!

speaker: Bronya
line: I've only seen this kind of monster before in the restricted zone...

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph, I don't care how big you are. You dare sneak up on us from behind. This is it for you, pal!

speaker: Seele
line: Ha... That was it?

text: Well, it was three against one.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Nah, I could've taken it on by myself. But still... fighting alongside you two was pretty fun.

text: It wouldn't have been so easy on your own though.

children.speaker: Seele
children.line: Please, you don't think I could do it? But still... fighting alongside you two was pretty fun.

speaker: Seele
line: Should be all clear now. Let's poke around.

speaker: Seele
line: The kids at the orphanage were always getting into scraps when we played out here. If I remember it right, there ought to be some supplies for our cuts and bruises stored in that corner there.

speaker: Seele
line: I just hope the monster didn't get to them.

speaker: Bronya
line: ...It wasn't my imagination.

speaker: Seele
line: Huh? What are you talking about?

speaker: Bronya
line: This building, this playground equipment... I've seen it all before.

speaker: Seele
line: What!? Come on, the overground and underground have been sealed off from each other for over ten years. It would've been news if a Silvermane Guard had come down here, let alone an Overworld princess.

speaker: Seele
line: Wait, unless, before that...

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Yes, it's a possibility. That would explain why my memory of it is so blurry.

speaker: Bronya
line: Come on, I need to look around a bit more before I can be sure...

text: Search for supplies in the orphanage

title: Step Description
content: You arrive at the orphanage entrance and have somewhat understood what's bothering Bronya — although it's just speculation, she might have lived here in the past...Anyways, first search this place for the supplies that Natasha wants.

speaker: Bronya
line: What's up here? Some kind of toy?

speaker: Seele
line: Yep. You pick, red or blue?

speaker: Bronya
line: Hm... blue.

speaker: Seele
line: Ha! Look at this. After over ten years, the teeth marks are still here.

speaker: Bronya
line: Teeth marks?

speaker: Seele
line: Alright, well... this one time, a big kid was trying to steal this toy from me. I couldn't outwrestle him for it, so I just bit down hard and hung on for dear life.

speaker: Bronya
line: ...How boorish.

speaker: Bronya
line: This swing is covered in dust... Hey, don't sit on it! It's filthy!

speaker: Seele
line: Ah, it sure brings back memories... I still remember one time I swung super high, and everyone was scared I would fly off.

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Who knew swinging could be so intense?

speaker: Seele
line: At the time, I wanted to swing myself into the sky and fly up to the Overworld.

speaker: Bronya
line: So dangerous... You're lucky to have lived till now.

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph, aren't we all, though?

text: (Investigate the crates on the stairs, optional)

speaker: Seele
line: I found this. Here, take it.

speaker: Bronya
line: What is this? ...A brooch?

speaker: Seele
line: Natasha would often teach us how to make different handicrafts. This must be some kid's masterpiece.

speaker: Bronya
line: And why give it to me?

speaker: Seele
line: You gave your medal to that kid Eric. This thing might not be as valuable, but it's at least a replacement of sorts.

speaker: Bronya
line: But didn't someone work hard to make this? I can't just take it from here...

speaker: Seele
line: ...You sure are prissy, huh? Just take it.

speaker: Seele
line: We've looked everywhere but here... I hope my memory is right.

speaker: Seele
line: It's... Ah! Yes, we found it!

speaker: Seele
line: Great, and it's barely damaged! Nat wouldn't have expected her old supplies from years ago to have stayed in such good condition.

speaker: Bronya
line: You should still check the expiration date for things like rubbing alcohol. If it's expired, it won't be effective.

speaker: Seele
line: Hm, true. Let me check a few bottles.

speaker: Seele
line: ...Huh? What's this?

speaker: Bronya
line: This is...

speaker: Bronya
line: This is... something from when I was a child.

speaker: Seele
line: Wh—When you were a child!? Are you sure...?

text: You came to this town as a child?

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: No, I remember now...

text: Just a coincidence. Lots of kids probably have this toy.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: There is no such coincidence in this world. I remember now...

text: Could it be, when you were a child...

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: Yes. I remember now...

speaker: Bronya
line: I—I used to live here... B—Before the Architects took me away, before Madam Cocolia adopted me... I used to live here! I'm... an undergrounder.

speaker: Seele
line: You're... an undergrounder? Wait a minute... you're saying that Cocolia, the Supreme Guardian , adopted you? Then—

speaker: Bronya
line: Yes. I'm the successor chosen by the Architects. In the future, I will become the guardian who leads Belobog .

speaker: Bronya
line: Why... Why didn't I remember this until now? My childhood memories are so blurry...

text: You were too little to remember clearly.
Cocolia must have done something to make you forget.

children.speaker: Bronya
children.line: No, mother would never do that to me... there's no way she would.

speaker: Bronya
line: The Architects said that the guardian's successor is selected from among all people in Belobog. The selection process can take anywhere from a few years to a few decades.

speaker: Bronya
line: During that time, all children of the appropriate age in both the Overworld and the Underworld will be tested. In the end, only one child deemed as "worthy" will be chosen.

speaker: Bronya
line: I... must have been chosen from among the children here and then taken to the surface...

speaker: Seele
line: The kids at the orphanage are always coming and going... I never thought that there would've been a future Supreme Guardian among us! Does Nat know about this? Could she have been keeping it a secret...

speaker: Bronya
line: ...I don't think she knows. The selection of the successor is done with utmost secrecy, and the child chosen must completely say goodbye to their past.

speaker: Bronya
line: And thus... I became the daughter of Madam Cocolia. My only identity is that of guardian successor, but I'm... not good enough...

speaker: Bronya
line: Every day I see Silvermane Guards sacrifice their lives in the Fragmentum, but I've never had the resolve to change mother's mind.

speaker: Bronya
line: The Underworld has been struggling, but I never tried to help. I didn't even know that it was my own home that had fallen into such a dire state...

speaker: Bronya
line: In the end, I haven't been able to guard anything. How could they have thought I was worthy to be the successor...

speaker: Seele
line: Hey! Are you done?

speaker: Bronya
line: ...Huh?

speaker: Seele
line: Wah wah wah... So annoying.

speaker: Bronya
line: I... What?

speaker: Seele
line: What? You thought I should feel sorry for you after your little speech? You can hide in your palace while you fuss over your Overworld problems, and on the front line it's not even you who's putting their life in danger. But in the Underworld, what do we worry about? If we'll have food for our next meal or survive to the next week!

speaker: Seele
line: Even if I am but a small glimmer of light in this world, I must try my best to shine brightly for others. Didn't you say that? Well, if you really want to protect everyone, what are you standing here crying for? Get to it!

speaker: Bronya
line: You're right... You're right, self-pity doesn't help solve anything.

speaker: Bronya
line: Thank you, Seele. Usually when I feel sorry for myself, I am met with gentle consolation. Never has anyone dared to be tough and make me snap out of it.

speaker: Seele
line: Hmph. I'm no good at consoling, but I can hit you on the head a few times. No problem.

speaker: Seele
line: ...I can tell that you have a big burden to carry. Why do you force yourself to?

speaker: Bronya
line: ...As the successor to the guardian of Belobog, I must always be vigilant of my behavior and thoughts.

speaker: Seele
line: Yeah yeah, Lady Bronya~ Hmph, Miss Future Supreme Guardian comes from the same orphanage as me... Who thought it would be a good idea to put us together, huh?

speaker: Seele
line: How about I show you around the orphanage a bit more? Unlike you, my memories from when I was little are crystal clear.

speaker: Bronya
line: Okay, I'll indulge in old memories with you for a while.

text: Search for supplies around the orphanage

title: Step Description
content: You naturally find the supplies, Bronya naturally finds the item to prove her past, and Seele naturally feels very shocked about all of this.The two who almost became childhood friends naturally go for a trip down the memory lane and begin a very long and deep conversation...Although you would really like to ask them when they become such great friends that share all their secrets with one another, would you be able to bring yourself to disturb the rare peace in front of you?You couldn't. So you decide to venture further around the orphanage to search for the supplies...

text: (If the player approaches Seele and Bronya)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I should let those two be alone for a bit...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (The only thing left to find is painkillers. I'll see if there's any nearby.)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (What's that sound...)
Oh! It's here, we found it! Thank you, Perkins !
Beep — Don't mention it, Clara .

speaker: Guardbot
line: Warning. Warning. Danger detected—

speaker: Guardbot
line: Protect Clara. Initiating active defense mode—

speaker: Clara
line: Perkins, don't! Stop!

speaker: Clara
line: ▶ I've seen this person before. ( H—He's / Sh—She's ) not bad, right?

speaker: Perkins
line: Command received. Danger removed. Deactivating active defense mode.

speaker: Clara
line: ▶ This place is dangerous. You should leave.

text: I'm looking for medicine to help the injured.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Oh? I came here for these painkillers, too.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: There are a lot of people hurt at the vagrant camp, I guess the miners are no different? *sigh* If everyone could just get along, things would be easier...

text: Shouldn't you be the one leaving, missy?

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Perkins is protecting me. I'll be alright. I'm going to leave after I gather up these painkillers.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: ▶ ...Uh, is that what you're here for too?

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: That would make sense. I'm sure a lot of miners are injured, right? *sigh* If everyone could just get along, things would be easier...

speaker: Clara
line: Mm... Here you are. I hope the medicine is of help to you...

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: No.

speaker: Clara
line: Mr. Svarog, he... he's my family. I met Mr. Svarog when I was real little. He took me in and took care of me.

speaker: Clara
line: I'm really sorry about what happened back in the Great Mine ... Mr. Svarog doesn't trust any humans besides me, especially everyone from Wildfire .

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Mr. Svarog doesn't want to hurt people, but he always follows the calculations of his analysis. He thinks that interaction with humans is... inefficient.

text: Why did Svarog want to get involved in the incident in the mines?

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: He heard that the miners and vagrants had begun to engage in a large-scale conflict... He wanted to stop everyone from getting hurt fighting over the mines.

speaker: Clara
line: Wildfire wants everyone to leave the underground... But Mr. Svarog wants everyone to stay here. According to his calculations, the overground is already unsafe.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Yes, at least according to Mr. Svarog's calculations...

text: There must be some error in his system.

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: No, there can't be... Mr. Svarog is healthy, his system is always being maintained.

text: So he stands guard at the huge pillar stopping people from leaving?

children.speaker: Clara
children.line: Yes... Mr. Svarog is very stubborn.

speaker: Clara
line: He says that his responsibility is "preservation." To do that, he must make decisions that best protect humanity.

text: The Fragmentum will swallow up all of the underground sooner or later.
Sounds a lot like the Supreme Guardian.

speaker: Clara
line: I know that Wildfire wants to talk to Mr. Svarog... But no matter how many times you talk to him, Mr. Svarog won't change his mind...

speaker: Clara
line: So, please trust me! I'll try to persuade Mr. Svarog. Hopefully, one day he will finally listen...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Clara? What are you doing here?

speaker: Clara
line: You're... Miss Seele from Wildfire? I came here to...

text: You and Clara tell Seele and Bronya what you just discussed...

speaker: Seele
line: ...Why are you helping the vagrants look for medicine? If they're so great, how could they make a little girl go around running errands for them?

speaker: Clara
line: N—No, it's not like that. I wasn't made to do anything... It's just that, the living conditions for the vagrants aren't great. There's not even a clinic in their camp. So, I wanted to help them out.

speaker: Clara
line: Also, not all of them are bad people... everyone just wants to survive.

speaker: Clara
line: Miss Seele, did this medicine belong to Miss Natasha? Then... can you give me some? The vagrants' injuries are quite serious.

speaker: Seele
line: *sigh* I see. Let's split these painkillers then.

speaker: Clara
line: R—Really? We don't need to ask Miss Natasha first?

speaker: Seele
line: If I know Nat, she won't mind. Although this will make it more difficult for us... she'll understand. She always does.

speaker: Clara
line: Great, thank you, Miss Seele...

speaker: Bronya
line: Are you leaving? This old town is too dangerous. We'll accompany you part of the way.

speaker: Clara
line: I—It's fine, I have Perkins for company. And... I have some more things I need to look for here first.

speaker: Bronya
line: Understood. Be careful, though.

text: Meet up with Seele and the others

title: Step Description
content: You've had the feeling that someone has gotten to the supplies before you but you didn't think it'd be someone that you were close with.Okay, maybe not that close... but you've at least met her before — you're technically family to Clara now.Seele and Bronya finally end their conversation and approach the two of you just as you are asking Clara about her reason for being here.Perfect timing, now it's time for everyone to figure out what to do next.

speaker: Seele
line: Metal plates and bandages... rubbing alcohol... painkillers. Great, that's everything.

speaker: Seele
line: Let's go report to Natasha in Boulder Town, it won't take long to get back.
